description:
Could you trust an AI to teach you how to fly? I decided to find out! In this video, I'm doing a crazy experiment inside Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024: I'm attempting to start my Cessna 172 G1000 and take-off and use Microsoft Copilot as my one and only instructor, using its brand-new *Vision Mode*.

So, what is this tech? *Microsoft Copilot* is an AI assistant, and the new *Vision Mode* gives it eyes üëÅÔ∏è. It can analyze my screen in real-time, meaning I can ask it questions about my instruments, flight plan, or what a specific button does, just like a real co-pilot.

I'll be starting the aircraft, taking off, using the autopilot and try to configure a flight plan relying solely on the AI's instructions. Will it lead me to a perfectly being able to perform all steps, or will it be a total disaster? This could be the most futuristic or the most chaotic flight I've ever had. Buckle up! ‚úàÔ∏è
